title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
Ok first of all I fixed my 2nd board today on my own, following the power rails I found out S5 was missing, that one was easy since all I had to replace was a filter and done. 

This other board 820-4924 is in S4 state, both C7185 and R7185 were a little corroded so I replaced them, still no power, PS is showing 0.012a steady and nothing gets hot, U1900 has PP3V42_G3H in pin 13 and pin 1 also gets 3.42v but all else is missing, I don't know why I got stock there and don't know where to go.

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
Post exact voltage for PPBUS_G3H and PP3V42_G3H.
Be sure to use original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger. Do you get orange light?
Check SMC_RESET_L, 3V3_S5/SUS, PM_RSMRST_L, AVREF_SMC.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
Some more relevant info:

[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PPBUS_G3H 12.26v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PP3V42_G3H 3.44v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PPVRTC_G3H 3.39v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PP5V_S5 0v

U7501 gets 12v in via pin 23 pin 29 0v, pin 25 0.238, pin 26 0.138[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
Original charger with no adapter, no orange light, only green steady light.

How to SMC bypass mode?

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]SMC_RESET_L 0.413v 
3V3_S5 0.240v
3V3_SUS 0.137v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
"[COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]SMC_RESET_L 0.413v"
This explain all actual symptoms.

Post U5110 voltages.
Post resistance to ground on pins 5 & 8.[/FONT][/COLOR]

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
U5510

pin 1 3.412v, pin 2 0v, pin 3 3.412v, pin 4 2.811v
pin 5 0.586v, pin 6 3.40v, pin 7 3.40v, pin 8 3.38

Resistance to ground on pin 5 17.15k, pin 8 356.5k

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
If R5100 is OK, remove U5110 and check again SMC_RESET_L.
If now OK, change U5110.
If still low, remove R 7100; if OK, change U7100.
J6100 can pull down SMC_RESET_L, if corroded.
SMC is the last option...

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: R5100 is 71.5k one end gets 3.42v and the other end 0.585v

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: OK replaced U5110 with SN0903049 I dont have a donor for SN0903048 I hope that one works, also replaced U7100, [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]SMC_RESET_L is now 1.48v but no fan spin :([/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: Remove U5110 and see if it goes high to 3.4. If no, probably bad SMC.

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
"[COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]SMC_RESET_L is now 1.48v"
Must be steady 3.3V.
Do all above mentioned...[/FONT][/COLOR]

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: Thanks my bad, I did not follow your instructions properly, when I remove U5110 [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]SMC_RESET_L goes a little down to 0.597v but it doens come up to 3.42v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: If you did first steps, only remain J6100 and SMC...

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: J6100 is spotless, I also double checked and all else is good, what is standard practice to replace SMC, do people buy them already programmed or do people buy the programming machine, sorry I ma clueless here, also if the recommendation is to buy it programmed is there a good place to do so?

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
I recommend to reball it first.
Also you can try a reflow, using quality flux.
Heat until 180-200 degrees, just to burn eventually crap underneath.

To change it, need one from donor board, same 4924 model.

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: Ok thanks, I will try that now, I don't have a donor, any other options?

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
Buy scrap boards from China.
You can get them for 15-25 bucks.
Use search function on the forum...

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: You cannot program SMCs not possible. Must pull and reball from an identical donor.

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: Reflowing the SMC fixed the [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]SMC_RESET_L [/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT] problem and it is now 3.4v, I now get a orange light in the charger but no fan spin, PP5V_S5 is a little low at 4.75v,  PP5V_S3 missing

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: Did you resolder U5110?

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message: Yes U5110 is back on 3.4v on pins 1,3,5,6,7 pin 4 2.8v and pin 8 3.29v

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
Ok Macbook powers on now, yeah! 

...

But it wont charge the battery, battery health from OS saids is fine, works of fine from the battery but it wont charge, new original charger, even tried another known good 85w charger and same problem... I was already celebrating :(

title: 820-4924 S4 state no power on
message:
All good now U7100 was bad, replaced it and all done! 

Muchas gracias!
